div.p: The School City of Hobart Food Service and Support Departments will be distributing FREE meals on Wednesdays until the start of the summer food program in an effort to support our community during the extended closure of our schools. Please click the image to see dates, locations, and important safety guidelines to follow. #BrickieStrong

a.title: Go to comments for SCOH Bagged Lunch Program

img.alt: Digital Edition of Focus on Education

a.span: Digital Edition of Focus on Education

div.p: Enjoy this month's newsletter and find out what amazing things our Brickies are doing!

a.title: Go to comments for Digital Edition of Focus on Education

div.p: Brickie Community Health Clinic is a great resource for the community to receive health care! From sore throats to school physicals, Julie Burk, FNP and her team have you covered! The Brickie Clinic is open to the public and located inside HHS.

a.title: Go to comments for Brickie Community Health Clinic

div.p: Due to the Coronavirus, the Governor has announced that schools will be closed through May 1st, and events are cancelled. He will revisit the rest of the year as this pandemic evolves.

a.title: Go to comments for SCOH Coronavirus Information Page

img.alt: Find bus stop information including times for your stop, schedules and updates using thee Here Come

div.p: Stay informed with your bus route updates by using the Here Comes the Bus technology with information from the SCOH's Transportation Department! Learn more here!

a.title: Go to comments for Here Comes the Bus!

div.p: Would you like to easily access your child's Skyward anywhere at anytime? Now you can with the Skyward App!

a.title: Go to comments for Skyward Family Access

div.h1: School City of Hobart is Building College and Career Ready Students One Brick at a Time!

span.p: The School City of Hobart Community will foster intellectual curiosity, natural abilities, critical thinking, and literacy in students while developing respectful and responsible citizens who are excited about the challenges of tomorrow, confident in their ability to chart the future, and dedicated to the pursuit of lifelong learning.

Our Schools Equip Children for Adulthood
Our Schools Address the Needs of Individual Students
Our Schools Are Community Schools
Our Schools Are Committed to Success

Did you know that every school in the School City of Hobart is accredited by
AdvancEd's North Central Association Commission on Accreditation and School Improvement?

You can learn more by visiting our
AdvancEd Data Profiles and Action Plans
on this web site.

img.br:
The Indiana Department of Education has identified a great need for more rigorous and engaging STEM Education. STEM certified schools serve as models for Indiana and their commitment to teaching the STEM disciplines of science, technology, engineering, and math - untimately preparing studetns for success in the 21st century!
In Indiana, there are only 60 schools who have received the distinction of being recognized as entirely STEM certitied through the Department of Education.
The School City of Hobart is proud to have ALL 6 of our schools STEM certified which means that 1/10 of all schools certified in the state of Indiana are in the School City of Hobart!
Schools are chosen to receive certification based on their commitment to teaching the STEM disciplines of science, technology, engineering, and math throughout the entire school. STEM Certified Schools exemplify a highly non-traditional approach to education, employing a great deal of inquiry, project-based learning, community engagement, entrepreneurship, student-centered classrooms, integration into humanities and related arts, and out of school STEM activities.

span.p: Use the anonymous tipline to report bullying, intimidation, harassment, weapons, drugs, dating violence and more in 4 easy ways.
Call or text to 219-942-TIPS, email to 1190@alert1.us, or visit our site at http://1190.alert1.us. All tips are anonymous!

p.a: State of Indiana Gateway Online Dashboard

span.p:
The School City of Hobart does not discriminate on the basis of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age,
sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, or disability, including limited English proficiency.

div.p: If you use assistive technology (such as a Braille reader, a screen reader, or TTY) and the format of any material on this Web site interferes with your ability to access information, please contact our webmaster using the link at the bottom of any page on our district site or at webcontact@hobart.k12.in.us. For more information, please click here to see our ADA Compliance Notice.
